radiographic_examinations.findings: The base of the appendix is mildly enlarged, measuring up to 8 mm, with thickened walls, together with mucosal hyperemia and periappendiceal fat stranding, findings are compatible with early acute appendicitis. No abscess or perforation. Visualized lung fields are within normal limits. There is no evidence of pleural or pericardial effusion. The liver, pancreas, spleen, adrenals, kidneys, stomach, small bowel loops, colon, and rectum are all within normal limits.
